MERRIMACK SCHOOL BOARD VACANCY

Anyone, who is interested in being considered for appointment to the Merrimack School Board should email a letter of interest to cinda.guagliumi@sau26.org or mail a letter of interest to:

Cinda Guagliumi, School Board Chair
c/o Merrimack School District/SAU #26
36 McElwain Street
Merrimack, NH 03054

All emails or letters must be received by 4:30 p.m. on Friday, September 18, 2020. The School Board will conduct applicant interviews with the intent of seating a new School Board Member on October 5, 2020.

Posted: September 9, 2020

post_text:
Good Evening Merrimack Families and District Staff~

I am writing to remind you of a Virtual Town Hall Meeting to answer questions regarding school reopening. This event will take place on Wednesday, July 29th from 6:30 p.m. to 8:00 p.m.

Superintendent McLaughlin will be joined by Assistant Superintendents Fabrizio and Shevenell to provide answers to many questions provided by our community regarding school reopening and will share updates to plans underway for school reopening.

For telephone access to this meeting please dial either of the following phone numbers and enter the Webinar ID number when prompted:

346-248-7799 or 669-900-9128

Webinar ID: 823 1575 4259

To View the Meeting:
‚Ä¢ Merrimack TV Channel 21 (Comcast)
‚Ä¢ Merrimack TV Facebook Live Page www.facebook.com/merrimacktv

We look forward to hosting this event in an effort to continue to provide our community with information regarding school reopening.

Thank you.

Mark McLaughlin
Superintendent

post_text:
For Immediate Release
School Budget Committee Vacancy
The Merrimack School District Budget Committee announces that it has 2 open seats until the April 2021 election. The Committee is looking for Merrimack residents who are registered voters and who have an interest in filling one of these seats for the upcoming budget year.
Anyone interested should send a letter of interest containing name, address, email and phone number to:

Merrimack School District Budget Committee
attn: Chuck Mower, Chair
c/o Merrimack School District, SAU 26
36 McElwain St
Merrimack, NH 03054

The letter must be received by August 7, 2020.

On August 11, 2020 at 7 pm in the cafeteria at Merrimack Middle School, the Committee will meet to hold public interviews with those who have submitted letters of interest and determine the final process for filling the vacant seats.

Anyone with questions should contact Chuck Mower at 424-1200.

Contact Information for this Press Release:
Chuck Mower, Chair
School District Budget Committee
424-1200

post_text:
Dear Merrimack Community-

Due to a printer‚Äôs error, two items on the school district‚Äôs voter‚Äôs guide must be corrected. Attached you will find, highlighted in yellow, the corrected items. On behalf of the printer, we apologize for any confusion this may have caused. Our goal is always to provide accurate information to assist our constituents in the important decisions they are asked to make at the town vote and these corrections are made in support of that goal. Please use the attached voter‚Äôs guide as your up to date reference. In addition, we have updated the voter‚Äôs guide to reflect the impact of the town‚Äôs delayed vote on certain warrant articles related to maintenance projects. Thank you.

post_text: Please help us honor JMUES Grade 5 Teacher, William Sawyer, with a retirement parade on Tuesday, June 2 between 3:30 and 4:30 pm. Mr. Sawyer has worked as a teacher in the Merrimack School District for 39 years. He has worked at JMUES for 16 years, and at MES for the years prior. The parade route will begin by pulling off Baboosic Lake Rd. on to School St. (between JMUES and the Church), around the oval parking lot by the Smith Gym, then up Bishop St. to McElwain St. and back to Baboosic Lake Rd.

Dear Merrimack Families and District Staff~



I am writing to correct an error I made in tonight‚Äôs message. The Mastricola Elementary School Year End Parade is scheduled for TOMORROW, MAY 29th at 1:30 pm. My message tonight indicated that the MES parade had already occurred. It has not.



So, to all MES families, please be sure to note that the year end parade at Mastricola Elementary School is scheduled for TOMORROW, MAY 29th at 1:30 pm.



Please accept my apologies for this error. The MES community is anxious to celebrate with you all tomorrow.



Sincerely,



Mark McLaughlin

The Merrimack school district has had to suspend its lunch program for families due to a custodian having tested positive for COVID-19 for this Tuesday and Wednesday

The custodian had no direct contact with the food program.

The board approved the district to use a Caterer to continue the program this Thursday at 11:00am.

post_text:
Providing a Free Bag Lunch
Starting tomorrow, 3/18/2020, at 10:30 AM to 12:30 PM, the Merrimack School District will be providing a ‚Äúgrab and go lunch‚Äù to all who have students in the Merrimack School District free of charge. The pickup site will be at Merrimack High School during those hours under the tent at the alternate front entrance. Please come up O‚ÄôGara Drive and stop at the pickup location. Someone will be there to serve you. No need to get out of your car. For those that do not have transportation, please call our transportation company STA at 603-424-7880 from the hours of 7:30 AM to 9:30 AM, place your order and they will deliver meals to your home.

Sincerely,
Matt Shevenell
Merrimack School District

post_text: It has just come to our attention that an article in the Nashua Telegraph misidentifies SAU 29 as the Merrimack School District. We are SAU 26. This article states that the Merrimack School District made a decision to close school on Monday. The Nashua Telegraph article is wrong. No such decision has been taken yet by the Merrimack School District. If and when the Merrimack School District makes such a decision, the Merrimack community will be notified through our internal communication platform (Facebook, Website, School Messenger).
text: It has just come to our attention that an article in the Nashua Telegraph misidentifies SAU 29 as the Merrimack School District. We are SAU 26. This article states that the Merrimack School District made a decision to close school on Monday. The Nashua Telegraph article is wrong. No such decision has been taken yet by the Merrimack School District. If and when the Merrimack School District makes such a decision, the Merrimack community will be notified through our internal communication platform (Facebook, Website, School Messenger).

TFS Giving

Under Ms. Saucier‚Äôs ( Physical Education Teacher) leadership. TFS students and staff won last year‚Äôs Kids Heart Challenge in Division two by raising over $17,000. In the last seven years, TFS has raised over $100, 000 for the American Heart Association through participation in the Challenge. Kudos to Ms. Saucier and our TFS community! Better Together!

post_text:
Merrimack High School -
Random Acts of Kindness and homeroom advisories co-sponsored a winter clothing and tie blanket drive. Homerooms created 88 tie blankets for homeless people, and a group of MHS students (and Santa) delivered the blankets to Veteran's Memorial Park in Manchester on December 20th. Next, the students visited Families in Transition where they donated canned goods, winter clothing, and other supplies. They also had a tour of the facility and learned about the services that this organization provides. This project was a great service opportunity for MHS students.
text:
Merrimack High School -
Random Acts of Kindness and homeroom advisories co-sponsored a winter clothing and tie blanket drive. Homerooms created 88 tie blankets for homeless people, and a group of MHS students (and Santa) delivered the blankets to Veteran's Memorial Park in Manchester on December 20th. Next, the students visited Families in Transition where they donated canned goods, winter clothing, and other supplies. They also had a tour of the facility and learned about the services that this organization provides. This project was a great service opportunity for MHS students.

post_text:
For Immediate Release

School Budget Committee Vacancy

The Merrimack School District Budget Committee announces that it has an open seat until the April 2020 election. The Committee is looking for Merrimack residents who are registered voters and who have an interest in filling this seat for the upcoming budget process.

Anyone interested should send a letter of interest containing name, address, email and phone number to:

Merrimack School District Budget Committee attn: Stan Heinrich, Chair
c/o Merrimack School District, SAU 26 36 McElwain St
Merrimack, NH 03054

The letter must be received by January 3, 2020.

On January 7, 2020 (snow date January 9) at 7 pm in the Merrimack High School Cafeteria, the Committee will meet to hold public interviews with those who have submitted letters of interest and determine the final process for filling the vacant seat.

Anyone with questions should contact Stan Heinrich at 261-9119.

Contact Information for this Press Release: Stan Heinrich, Chair
School District Budget Committee 8 Edgewood Avenue
261-9119
text:
For Immediate Release

School Budget Committee Vacancy

The Merrimack School District Budget Committee announces that it has an open seat until the April 2020 election. The Committee is looking for Merrimack residents who are registered voters and who have an interest in filling this seat for the upcoming budget process.

Anyone interested should send a letter of interest containing name, address, email and phone number to:

Merrimack School District Budget Committee attn: Stan Heinrich, Chair
c/o Merrimack School District, SAU 26 36 McElwain St
Merrimack, NH 03054

The letter must be received by January 3, 2020.

On January 7, 2020 (snow date January 9) at 7 pm in the Merrimack High School Cafeteria, the Committee will meet to hold public interviews with those who have submitted letters of interest and determine the final process for filling the vacant seat.

Anyone with questions should contact Stan Heinrich at 261-9119.

Contact Information for this Press Release: Stan Heinrich, Chair
School District Budget Committee 8 Edgewood Avenue
261-9119

post_text: Thorntons Ferry School we had a special visit from Korean War Veteran Mr. DiMare and his family. They visited thhe school because Mrs. Walter and her 4th Grade Class wrote letters to him and other veterans in recognition for their years of service and for participation in a Honor Flight. Mr. DiMare and his family were so touched by the cards, they came to Thorntons Ferry to say thank you to Mrs. Walter and our students. Today, he presented artifacts and stories from his years in the Navy and his family kindly gave each student in Mrs. Walter‚Äôs class a puzzle for the Holidays. We are so proud of Mrs. Walter and all she does for our Veterans and for our students who once again demonstrated kindness and gratitude.

post_text:
Greetings Merrimack!

I have just completed a conversation with our Director of Transportation, who has been in touch with our Department of Public Works.

We expect to see continued light snow through the day. We anticipate up to 4 inches by the time of dismissal. At this time no ice, sleet or freezing rain is expected.

The DPW is working to maintain our roads. We are confident in their work and expect that their treatment of our roads will work to remove/melt most of the snow cover to ensure safe travels through Merrimack.

All evening activities will remain as previously scheduled.

As long as everyone takes their time and is mindful of traffic, we should have a great day.

However, winter chorus/band concert at the middle school is cancelled for this evening.

Thank you.

Mark McLaughlin

post_text:
TFS Community Time
Community Time is a scheduled time in our school day for students in grades K-4 level to come together every other week for approximately 30 minutes to focus on creating a sense of belonging and connection with their peers in their grade and with "helpers" across our school. Students and staff participate in a grade-level greeting, check in with each other, listen to a story and practice a mindfulness moment to get their brains and bodies ready for learning. Community time ends with students in the entire grade level singing our TFS School Song. Go TFS Hawks! Better Together!

post_text: Bedford Road Bridge - Reeds Ferry School (Start of the School Year)
shared_text:
Merrimack TV
August 21, 2019 at 10:06 AM ¬∑

VIDEO: Heavy traffic and expected travel delays for the start of the school year. Please watch this video and share on your social media pages.

Merrimack Department of Public Works, Merrimack School District, and Merrimack Police Department urge you to prepare yourself for September 3rd and the first few months of the school year.

Due to the Bedford Road bridge construction, expect significant delays on Bedford Rd between Pearson and Catskill. This 3 minute video explains what you can do to avoid an accident and prevent further delays.

Thanks for sharing and following Merrimack TV.

:)

post_text:
This is an important message from the Merrimack School District.
Next week we will be welcoming back all our teachers for three days of professional development prior to the start of the new school year. This professional development is designed to provide teachers with strategies and supports in service of student success.
This year, we have also invited all office staff from each school and the superintendent‚Äôs office to join in this professional development for one of those three days. As a consequence, all school offices, and the central office, will be closed on Tuesday, August 27th. All school offices, and the central office, will reopen on Wednesday, August 28th. We appreciate your understanding as we provide professional development support to these important members of our school district‚Äôs team.

Due to the cold weather conditions, the Merrimack School District will have a 2 hour delay on Tuesday January 22nd with no AM Pre-School. For Merrimack High School Students, the 1st period final will begin at 9:35 AM. Lunch will be served in the cafeteria from 11:15 AM until 12:05.
The period 2 final will be administered during the make up time from 12:10 to 1:50 PM. Dismissal and bus pick-up time will be 1:50 - 2:05 PM.

Sincerely,
Matt Shevenell

post_text:
Merrimack Early Education Program (MEEP)
The Merrimack School District will begin enrollment for its inclusionary preschool program Merrimack Early Education Program (MEEP), for the 2019-20 school year on January 7, 2019. James Mastricola, Reeds Ferry and Thorntons Ferry Elementary Schools offer pre-school classes. These classrooms include preschoolers with and without developmental or learning delays to provide opportunities for children to play and learn together. Additional information about the MEEP program can be found HERE https://www.sau26.org/site/Default.aspx?PageID=4286

or by contacting the Pre-school Coordinator, Kara Cave at 424-6215 or by email at: Kara.Cave@sau26.org
